title: Cat. 5  Tankard, c. 1705
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Jeremiah Dummer (American, 1645–1718)  
Boston, Massachusetts  
Silver; 15 × 10.2 × 17.8 cm (6 × 4 5/8 × 7 1/4 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of the Antiquarian Society through the Mr. and Mrs. William Y. Hutchinson Fund, 1985.780

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On lid and on body (fig. 5.1)

Engraved on handle: B / IE (fig. 5.2)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With Firestone and Parson, Boston, by 1985.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1985.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Art Institute of Chicago, A Decade of Decorative Arts: The Antiquarian Society of the Art Institute of Chicago, November 12, 1986–January 4, 1987, pp. 77–78, cat. 51 (ill.).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Art Institute of Chicago (1986), p. 20, fig. 6 (ill.).

Naeve et al. (1986), pp. 77–78, cat. 51 (ill.).

Barter et al. (1998), pp. 54–56, cat. 6 (ill.).

Kane et al. (1998), p. 395.

</section><section id="figures">Tankard, c. 1705.

fig. 5.1 fig. 5.2 </section>
